subject: RE: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... Yes, empty catch clauses are okay if the developer is clearly showing it s expected.  I use ignore myself: catch(NoObjectFoundException ignore) { //
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of haefeleuser

> I do it in this manner:
>
> try
> {
> articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
> }
> catch(NoObjectFoundException e)
> {
> // Its okay since we expect it.
> }

Yes, empty catch clauses are okay if the developer is clearly showing it's
expected. I use "ignore" myself:

catch(NoObjectFoundException ignore)
{
// Ignore
}
